Air Quality & Control

The quality of air in your home is actually critical to your comfort—especially if you or any of your family members suffer from asthma or allergies. According to the EPA, concentrations of toxic pollutants can be up to one hundred times greater inside a home than outside, even in our smoggiest cities. Poor ventilation in the home can lead to stuffy air and a build-up of unpleasant odors, irritating pollutants and potentially harmful gasses such as radon or carbon monoxide. As homes are built tighter with better windows, more insulation and higher-efficiency heating and cooling systems, the need for adequate ventilation becomes even more important. Call us today to learn more about the benefits of clean indoor air or to talk with us about any of the services that we offer.

Air Cleaners

Home air cleaners can make a huge difference in the air breathed by you and your family. Your home’s ability to filter and clean the air that you breathe is one of its more important functions, and something to keep in mind with regards to regular home maintenance. If you’re interested in air filter installation or if your air filters aren’t working, call Howard Mechanical today for repair.

Dehumidifier and Humidifiers

During the winter, the air can get extremely dry. Likewise, during the summer the air can get very humid. Both of these extremes can have a negative impact on the quality of air in your home. Using a dehumidifier to remove moisture and a humidifier to add moisture can be a great way to improve the quality of air in your home. Call Howard Mechanical today for more information on installations and repairs.

Ultraviolet Light Services

You may not know it, but ultraviolet light is incredibly harmful to microorganisms. In fact, UV light is actually used as a disinfecting agent in medical facilities. By installing an ultraviolet germicidal light system in your home’s ducts or air handler, you could eliminate many organic contaminants like bacteria, mold spores, and viruses. Contact Howard Mechanical today for more information.

Duct Repair and Replacement

Air ducts are a fundamentally important part of any heating and cooling system. If you feel your heating and cooling system isn’t working as efficiently or effectively as it could be, there’s a good chance the problem may lie in your ducts. Contact Howard Mechanical and an expert will help you identify and fix any issues your ductwork may be causing you. Our experts can quickly find the holes and repair them so that your heating and air conditioning system can get back on track.

Ductwork Services

If you’re planning on building a new home and need a contractor to install the new ducts or to build you custom ducts, call Howard Mechanical today. We can help you find the perfect standard size for your home and install it. We also provide custom ductwork, which could last longer and might be able to increase the efficiency of your heating and AC systems.
